# The Pub Crawl to the Pub that Crawls
DM (Jonny) BOT 06-02-2024 16:45
Ostara, the 16th night of the Raven Moon, otherwise known as the Spring Equinox. A night to celebrate the end of the cold, harsh winter, as light beats out darkness (at least in terms of daylight hours) in the Barovian Valley. You've likely missed the long light of the summer days, especially as none of you are Twilight Cleris, Shadow Sorcerers, or Gloomstalker Rangers! *For whatever reason, you find yourselves in the small village of Barovia this evening, standing outside the Blood on the Vine. What is normally a somewhat drab, dreary place, is replaced by the hustle and bustle of a rowdy tavern in good spirits. Clearly the villagers are out to welcome the coming of spring, and a kernel of hope and optimism warms your heart at the thought. Entering into the tavern, you find the all the booths and tables taken by villagers, but several stools are available at the bar, with only two currently occupied; one by a familiar face for anyone adorned with a tattoo, Saoirse the tattoo artist sits chatting to an unknown young halfling woman. The tavern is filled with the sound of merriment, with folk starting to shout to make themselves heard. Even the barkeep, Arik, seems to be in high spirits; probably to do with the coins in his tip jar! Still, the feeling of festivities can't help but put you in a good mood.*
Makayla BOT 06-02-2024 19:22
Makayla dances into familiar tavern, a grin on their face, their lute slung over their back. Expertly weaving through the crowd, Makayla nabs one of the bar stools, and jumps onto it with a flourish, waving to the bar keep, and winking at Saoirise. ‚ÄúSome wine, when you get a moment!‚Äù they call out. Without really pausing, Makayla grabs the lute and starts strumming quietly, humming along to a familiar song as they wait for their drink. (edited)
Xia Guang ÈúûÂÖâ BOT 06-02-2024 19:48
Enter Xia The door of the tavern creaks open as a young woman walks in -- she's wearing a flowy white and jade green dress that does practically nothing against the cold, but she's also sporting a new cloak, which is slightly damp from the mists. "Ah, at least it's not raining constantly anymore." She says with some cheer in her voice to no one in particular, as she begins to make strange hand gestures at her very muddied cloth shoes. As her fingers hover nimbly above them, the splotches of mud simply disappearing, slowly revealing some hand-embroidered pink lotuses along the white cloth, cushioned between round green leaves as if floating on a pond. [Casting Prestidigitation] "Now, something to warm my belly..." she walks over to the bar and a tiny little white owl hops out of the hood of her cloak. It shakes itself vigorously and immediately regains some of the poof in its feathers. It's so puffy that it practically looks like a little round snowball. This was apparently whom she was talking to when she walked in the door. The newcomer absent-mindedly forgot to close the tavern door, and now the patrons sitting near the door are grumbling as the cold air continues to seep in, robbing them of their comfort. "One mulled wine please!" She calls out toward the bar. "Can you put some extra sugar or honey in it? And some extra spices? I'll leave a nice tip if I can't even taste the alcohol!" She winks at Arik.

Anton BOT 08-02-2024 07:33
Anton had forgotten how easily Makayla slips into another character. They were like a mirror image of himself, only flipped around. Anton always chose characters that can hide in the shadows, unseen. But seeing the shapeshifter always choose the ones that will get the most attention, and do it with such flamboyance, always made him think about how things can be similar and different at the same time. Was he jealous? Not only of the easiness of change, but also the courage to change into things he might not dare? Perhaps. But that's for later. For now, they need five willing members for this quest. Anton leans closer to everlen and says to them calmly "But are you willing to be part of the histories you've written? It's not only about the style of how you describe it. It's whether you think it's right to write the story actively as it's going on. You don't have to be the main character like a friend over there. Sometimes the secondary characters have more impact on the story than people realize. Come to think of it, even narrators can be characters in the story. Some great historians were. I'm sure you can stay impartial even if you take part in the events as they unfold."

*The group leave the warmth and comford of the Blood on the Vine Inn and head out into the dark, damp Barovian night. Strangely tonight, the clouds overhead have cleared, and the land is lit with the bright, Raven Moon, signalling the start of spring, (and also the arrival of the crawling pub!). The stars are twinkling overhead, and filled with the warming liqueur of the tavern, the party march on in relatively good spirits, out of the village of Barovia, west on the long road towards the Winery. As they walk and they chat, the ever-present mist starts to close in on the group. They can still see clearly the moon and stars in the sky above, but very quickly they loose vision out to more than about 10ft in any other direction. They can follow the road still, but begin to not even be able to see the vegetation at the side of the road. Unnerving as this is, the group continue on, mostly knowing the way, at least for the first few miles. But miles they do not travel before an even stranger effect kicks in. Not 10 minutes into their walk, the stars and the moon begin to rotate in the sky. Not fast, by any means, but in a way that is noticeable to the naked eye, in real time. After a minute of this slow rotation, they appear to come to a stop once more, and the mists abate, allowing them to view their surroundings once more. The farmland and fields surrounding Barovia village have been replaced by rows of vines of grapes. Somehow, the group find themselves within the land of the vineyard, not 5 minutes from the doors of the winery itself! The lights of the building can be seen in a valley below, and the road snakes down the hill between the vineyards the line the valley to meet it.* (edited)
